channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump's five new plans after becoming President
item.description: Donald Trump announced a plan to restore freedom of expression. He pledged to eliminate the "left-wing censorship regime". He proposed a five-point strategy. It includes prohibiting federal bodies from partnering with private organizations on speech restriction. It also includes directing the Department of Justice to examine censorship activities. Trump will issue an executive order immediately after taking office.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif congratulates Trump on X, community note claims 'unlawful VPN use'
item.description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif congratulated Donald Trump on winning a second term as US President in a tweet, despite having banned X in Pakistan. X users pointed out the irony, noting that Sharif was using a VPN to access the platform illegally.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Notre Dame's bells ring for first time after 5 years of silence since catastrophic fire
item.description: The eight bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang together for the first time since the 2019 fire, marking a significant step in the cathedral's restoration. The bells, housed in the northern belfry, underwent extensive repair and cleaning.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Candyman, Final Destination actor Tony Todd passes away at 69
item.description: Tony Todd, renowned for his chilling performance as Candyman and his contributions to the horror genre, passed away at 69. His career extended beyond horror, encompassing roles in Platoon, The Crow, and voice acting in video games like Spider-Man 2. Todd's legacy includes over 240 film and television appearances, leaving a lasting impact on the entertainment industry.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Qatar asks Hamas officials to leave country following pressure from US: Report
item.description: The US has urged Qatar to expel Hamas leaders. This follows Hamas's rejection of ceasefire and hostage exchange proposals. Qatar has asked Hamas leaders to leave. Qatar has hosted Hamas leaders since 2012 as part of a negotiation agreement. The US has expressed impatience with Qatar's ties to Hamas. Hamas officials deny receiving a formal request to leave Qatar.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Our relationship with India is much expanded': US defense secretary Lloyd Austin reflects on his 4-year tenure
item.description: US defense secretary Lloyd Austin emphasized the strengthening of global security alliances, particularly highlighting the growth of the US-India partnership. He acknowledged the Pentagon's focus on various regions, including the Indo-Pacific, while reaffirming support for Ukraine and addressing humanitarian concerns in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Parked vehicle with gas cylinders explodes on NYC street, damaging homes and cars, officials say
item.description: An SUV explosion in Queens, New York City, caused significant damage to nearby homes and vehicles. The explosion, captured on camera, was caused by the failure of a pressurized cylinder inside the vehicle, which was being used for construction and contained flammable materials. Thankfully, no injuries were reported.

item.title: US police arrest suspect in series of stabbings in Seattle
item.description: A man was arrested in downtown Seattle on Friday for allegedly stabbing five people. Police suspect he may also be responsible for five other stabbings in the same area since Thursday morning. The victims appear to have been targeted at random, with injuries ranging from minor cuts to serious stab wounds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The Handmaid's Tale' sales go up too...
Fear of 'Trump's America' fuels search for haven abroad
item.description: Following election results suggesting a second term for Donald Trump, online searches by Americans about emigrating to countries like Canada, New Zealand, and Australia saw a massive surge. This mirrors similar trends observed after the 2016 election, reflecting concerns among some Americans about the future of the country and its political climate.

item.title: Trudeau panel on US ties to prep for Don's dawn
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has reinstated a special cabinet committee to address concerns about a second Donald Trump presidency. The committee, chaired by Deputy PM Chrystia Freeland, will focus on crucial Canada-US issues, particularly in light of potential trade tensions. Canadian police are also preparing for a possible influx of asylum-seekers fleeing the US following Trump's victory.

item.title: Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam attacked by 'hit-&-run squads'
item.description: Amsterdam banned demonstrations and granted police emergency powers after antisemitic attacks on Israeli soccer fans. Youths on scooters targeted and assaulted fans throughout the city, leading to hospitalizations and numerous arrests. Israeli authorities are flying citizens back home amidst safety concerns and rising tensions.

item.title: Republicans widen Senate majority; House in balance
item.description: Republicans are nearing a narrow victory in the US House of Representatives, with control hanging on the outcome of a handful of remaining races. While Democrats flipped two New York seats, Republicans are projected to secure a Senate majority, bolstering Trump's agenda. However, a potential slim House majority could limit Trump's legislative ambitions.

item.title: Putin praises Trump, says Russia ready for dialogue; prez-elect hints they will speak
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Donald Trump on his election victory and commended his courage during a past assassination attempt. Putin expressed a willingness to resume dialogue with the Trump administration, acknowledging Trump's campaign remarks on Ukraine and US-Russia relations. However, Putin's spokesman clarified that Russia's stance on Ukraine remains unchanged.

item.title: Trump put Musk on phone with Zelensky during call
item.description: During a phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, former US President Donald Trump surprised many by handing the phone to Elon Musk. The nature of their conversation remains unclear, but sources suggest it was positive. This event raises questions about potential shifts in US-Ukraine relations under Trump's leadership, especially given his promise to swiftly end the conflict and Musk's significant support for Ukraine's war efforts through Starlink.

item.title: 'She just walked away from me': Red-district Dem's awkward meeting with Kamala Harris
item.description: Democrat Marie Gluesenkamp Perez, representative for Washington's 3rd district, recounted an awkward encounter with Vice President Kamala Harris at a Christmas party. She said she noticed that all garlands in the party were plastic. “I was strong-armed into taking a picture. I said, ‘Madam Vice President, we grow those where I live,'” Gluesenkamp told her but she didn't pay any attention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump handed phone to Elon Musk during call with Zelensky: Reports
item.description: Zeelensky called Trump to congratulate him on the election win and Trump, according to the reports, "did not leave Zelensky with a feeling of despair". "Musk also weighed in during the call to say he will continue supporting Ukraine through his Starlink," reports said. Donald Trump's chat with Zelensky was also positive, the reports said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli football fans clash with protesters in Amsterdam
Pakistan says it can serve as bridge between US and China
item.description: Pakistan has stated its intention to mediate between the United States and China amidst escalating global tensions. Despite close military ties with the US, Pakistan's economy relies heavily on China, prompting a neutral stance in the face of US-China rivalry. Islamabad emphasized its enduring strategic partnership with China, unaffected by US political shifts, while also expressing a commitment to strengthening its long-standing relationship with the US.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Who is Robert Lighthizer whom Trump has asked to be US trade chief?
item.description: Donald Trump has reportedly asked Robert Lighthizer to rejoin his administration as US Trade Representative. Lighthizer, known for his protectionist stance and alignment with Trump's trade policies, previously served in the same role during Trump's first term. His potential return will signal a renewed focus on aggressive trade tactics, including tariffs on imports.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
